title: How to fix a USB flash drive that is not recognized - Quora

response.answer_text: USB not recognized is the common problem reported by many users, it could be broken or other reason caused the drive error. But don't worry, you can follow the next guide to fix the flash drive not recognized error on Windows and Mac. There can be many reasons why Windows did not detect your flash drive. When users face problems with USB drives not showing up, most people believe that their drive is dead. However, this is only the worst-case scenario. There may be a problem with your computer hardware or with Windows itself which may cause a flash drive not detected an error. Do Preliminary Checks: When a USB drive is connected to your computer, it should ideally turn on automatically with flashing lights on the unit indicating activity.It’s possible that the flash drive could have been damaged. So check it physically to rule out any issues before trying again.Unplug the USB stick, shut down your computer, and unplug it from the power source. Wait up to one minute before restarting your computer and trying the flash drive again.Allow Your Computer To Load Fully before trying to connect USB. Some computers take longer to fully start.These preliminary checks can solve this issue if there is no major fault. However, if you are still facing problems then read the below ways to fix the drive. How do I fix USB Flash Drive not recognized? Check USB PortsUpdate Device DriversChange Power Management SettingsUpdating Windows SystemFormat USB Drive1. Check your USB Ports If your USB ports are not functioning properly, Windows won’t detect your USB flash drive. To check your USB ports, Navigate to Start > Control Panel > Hardware and Sound > Device Manager > Universal Serial BusClick on UninstallClick on Scan for Hardware ChangesIf Windows still doesn’t recognize your device after these steps, your USB ports are faulty. 2. Update your Device Drivers If your device drivers are outdated, Windows computers won't recognize USB. For Windows 10: Go to Settings, and click on Update & Security.By clicking on Windows Update and click the Check for updates button.These steps will update your device drivers. If your error was caused due to outdated drivers, it would be fixed. 3. Change Power Management Settings The power management settings in Windows 10 can also cause a flash drive not showing up the problem. To solve this issue, Navigate to Start > Control Panel > Hardware and Sound > Device Manager > Universal Serial Bus Double click on the first 'USB Root Hub' that you seeNavigate to the Power Management tabUncheck the option "Allow this computer to turn off this device to save power." Click on OK.Please repeat these steps above mentioned for each USB Root Hub device in your list of Universal Serial Bus controllersThis will solve the power management issue that may cause Windows not to recognize a flash drive. 4. Updating Windows System To update the Windows system on Windows would help the computer to recognize a USB device, follow these steps: Go to Control Panel > System and Security;Next, users need to make sure that the "Check for updates" option is selected;The Windows system will be updated.Then, users need to restart the system and connect the flash drive to make sure that the issue is solved.This will fix issues with your USB root hub, and hopefully, Windows will recognize your flash drive. 5. Format your USB Drive If you’ve tried all the above and nothing works, then your USB drive may be faulty. You’ll need to format the USB drive to get it to work again. To format USB drive, Navigate to Windows Disk Management toolRight-click on your USB device on the list of all disks and click on the formatNow that the flash drive not Recognized problem is solved, make sure you have back-up all important documents in the flash drive. This is to ensure that you will be able to access the files stored in the flash drive should it happen again.

First, make sure if the problem is with the flash drive or the USB port itself. Try to use the flash drive on a different USB port, a different system or laptop and also try to use it on a different device like with a phone using an OTG cable. If the flash drive gets recognized on other devices but not one device, then get the faulty USB port checked with a technician. If the USB is not recognized on any device, then check if you can see if the device is getting detected by your system. Right-click on the Windows icon, choose Disk Manager and check if your flash drive is detected. If yes, then use an application like Recuva to recover all your files. Once you have your files, format the drive and it will start working normally again. If the flash drive does not even get detected under Disk Manager, then there are no easy steps that can be taken by you to repair it. It is best to approach a professional data recovery team if you have important data. If there is no important data, then just replace the flash drive.
